div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

p.a: NYS State of Health Letter to Families
Child Care Survey Link for Essential Workers
CCS Parent Survey for Emergency School Closure

hr.p: In accordance with the Coronavirus Health and Safety Guidelines the tennis courts are locked up and all sports fields and playgrounds are no longer accessible. This is implemented to prohibit any group activity. Signage has been posted in the affected areas as a public notice to the community. The walking trail is not affected as long as social distancing practices are followed.

This is an important message from Clymer Central School. Yesterday, April 16th, Governor Andrew Cuomo announced New York State schools and non-essential businesses will remain closed through May 15th, saying the coronavirus pandemic still makes it unsafe to resume regular daily lives.

We will continue our food deliveries to those families who have chosen to receive them throughout the school closing. Families may still sign up to receive bagged meals for their children during this school closure by visiting our website or calling the cafeteria office at 716-355-2014. An updated food delivery schedule will be posted to our website once it has been finalized.

This is an important message from Clymer Central School. Families may still sign up to receive bagged meals for their children during this school closure by visiting our website or calling the cafeteria office at 716-355-2014. Please remember that this week’s food delivery will only take place on Wednesday between 7:30 and 10:00am. The food delivery schedule for the upcoming weeks is as follows: Wednesday, April 15th, Tuesday, April 21st, Friday, April 24th, and Tuesday, April 28th. Your food will be placed on the bus steps for you to take directly; please meet the bus when it arrives.

This is an important message from Clymer Central School. On Monday, April 6th Governor Andrew Cuomo announced New York State schools and non-essential businesses will remain closed through April 29th, saying the coronavirus pandemic still makes it unsafe to resume regular daily lives.

We will continue our food deliveries to those families who have chosen to receive them throughout the school closing. The updated food delivery schedule will be posted to our website once it has been finalized.

This is an important message from Clymer Central School regarding our updated food delivery schedule. Food deliveries this week for those that have responded to our CCS Parent Survey through our website or by phone will take place tomorrow, April 7th and Thursday, April 9th, between 7:30 and 10:00am directly to your residence. Next week, food delivery will take place on Wednesday, April 15th only. Your food will be placed on the bus steps for you to take directly; please meet the bus when it arrives. Continue to check the district website for updates.

ONLY SENT TO FAMILIES WITH STUDENTS IN KINDERGARTEN, GRADES 1 & 2 - This is an important message from Clymer Central School for parents with students in kindergarten, 1st grade, and 2nd grade. Academic packets and devices will be delivered to your residence tomorrow, April 3rd. Only the parents who requested a device will receive one tomorrow. A parent or student must be present when the devices are delivered. Devices will not be left if someone does not come to meet the bus when it arrives. Deliveries will take place between 7:30 am and 10:00 am directly to your residence tomorrow. Please meet the bus when it arrives.

ONLY SENT TO FAMILIES WITH STUDENTS IN GRADES 3 & 4 - This is an important message from Clymer Central School for parents with students in 3rd and 4th grade. Academic devices will be delivered to your residence tomorrow, March 31st. A parent or student must be present when the devices are delivered. Devices will not be left if someone does not come to meet the bus when it arrives. Deliveries will take place between 7:30 am and 10:00 am directly to your residence tomorrow. If your 3rd or 4th grade student has a sibling in a younger grade, their device will be dropped off at the same time. Please meet the bus when it arrives.

CCS Reminder - Child care services will be made available to families who are considered essential to the health and safety of the community. Families who are considered essential workers and cannot be excused from work are encouraged to complete the Child Care Need Survey above. Click here for further information: Child Care Services for Essential Workers

Child care services will be made available to families who are considered essential to the health and safety of the community. Families who are considered essential workers and cannot be excused from work are encouraged to complete the Child Care Need Survey above. Click here for further information: Child Care Services for Essential Workers

Food deliveries for those that have responded to our CCS Parent Survey through our website or by phone will take place tomorrow, March 24 and Friday March 27, between 7:30 and 10:00am directly to your residence. Please note that deliveries will arrive later due to less buses being used for delivery. Please meet the bus when it arrives. Your food will be placed on the bus steps for you to take directly. Our delivery schedule can be found below. Continue to check the district website for updates.

p.em: Thursday, April 9, 2020 - *This date has been added to our delivery schedule.

hr.p: Wednesday, April 15, 2020 - *This date has been added to our delivery schedule.

p.em: Tuesday, April 21, 2020 - *This date has been added to our delivery schedule.
Friday, April 24, 2020 - *This date has been added to our delivery schedule.
*This date has been added to our delivery schedule.

If you are interested in receiving bagged meals for your children during this closure, you may still sign up for food deliveries. Please complete the CCS Parent Survey for Emergency School Closure above, or call the cafeteria office at 716-355-2014. Food deliveries for those that have responded will take place between 7:30 and 10:00am directly to your residence on those dates; please meet the bus when it arrives.

hr.p: The first delivery of food and materials this morning was a HUGE success! THANK YOU to all who were a part of this process. If you are interested in receiving bagged meals for your children during this closure, please complete the CCS Parent Survey for Emergency School Closure above, or call the cafeteria office at 716-355-2014. Current lunch status will apply. Food deliveries for those that have responded will take place Tuesday, March 24 and Friday March 27, between 7:30 and 9:00am directly to your residence. Continue to check the district website for updates.

If you are interested in receiving bagged meals for your children during this closure, please complete the CCS Parent Survey for Emergency School Closure above, or call the cafeteria office at 716-355-2014. Current lunch status will apply. Food deliveries for those that have responded will take place tomorrow, 3/18/2020, between 7:30 and 9:00am directly to your residence; please meet the bus when it arrives. Pre-K through 6th grade academic packets and devices will be delivered at the same time. A parent or student must be present when the devices are delivered. We will notify of further updates.

Beginning Wednesday March 18th, teachers will be remotely providing instructions to students. Clymer Central School will be closed to students through Sunday April 19th. Students and staff are expected to return to school on Monday April 20th. Beginning on Wednesday March 18th, food will be delivered to eligible students between 7:30 and 9:00 am. If you qualify for food delivery, please visit our website under the COVID-19 tab, to complete the form. Students in PreK through 6th grade will also receive instructional materials (Grade 5/6 Chromebooks) the morning of March 18th. Students in grades 7 through 12 can pick up their devices, instruments and/or personal items at school on Tuesday March 17th from 9:00 am-11:00 am, 1:00 pm-2:30 pm or 6:00 pm-7:00 pm. Please enter at the SPC side of the building. Please continue to access the school website for ongoing updates.

p.em: Due to the 30 day state of emergency issued at 5:00 pm today by Chautauqua County Executive PJ Wendel regarding the COVID-19 coronavirus school will be canceled for all students beginning Monday, March 16th until further notice.

While there are no confirmed cases of the coronavirus/COVID-19, these measures are being taken as a precaution to prevent the spread of the illness. All staff should report to work at their normal time on Monday, March 16th to prepare for an extended school closure and to prepare for Alternative instruction for students. Information on remote and/or technology based instruction will be forthcoming later this week.
